sn1.9:1.2: Standing to one side, that deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.9:2.1: “Someone who’s fond of conceit can’t be tamed,
sn1.9:2.2: and someone without immersion can’t be a sage.
sn1.9:2.3: Living negligent alone in the wilderness,
sn1.9:2.4: they can’t pass beyond Death’s domain.”
sn1.9:3.1: “Having given up conceit, serene within oneself,
sn1.9:3.2: with a healthy heart, everywhere free;
